Hello Folks!

My question is how to connect/link 1 part to 2 sides of other parts. Please take a look on screen 

When i fly i see how incoming air make clearance/gap between my parts on line where they not connect and this gap is changing by wind power. At the same time all source parts is look stable to each other.

i've read ingame Editor control manual but still don't have answer =( how to do the same like on source Albatross 3 ? When i link my part then a can choose only 1 other part but source parts of wing is connected to each other somehow.

Sorry if this question is exist on forum, my english is bad.

Edited June 14, 2016 by untoha

Welcome to the forums!

Unfortunately, what you want is not possible. When you attach a part, it can connect to only ONE part. It's a fundamental limitation of the game.

If you look carefully at the craft you're modifying, you'll see that it is following the same rule already. There's no difference.

The game does have a "strut" connector part that can connect any TWO parts, which can be used to reinforce a craft's structural strength. However, it's not a great solution for what you're doing (adds mass and drag).

Your best bet would be to figure out a way to do what you want with fewer wing parts, or arrange them differently.

Thank you Snark. i got it but not sure that understand clearly about "strut" connector. now i can move big part of wessel and operate them. can i build 2 parts separately and then connect them? 

for history: i've add parts not the same like on source Albatros 3 wing.
